page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: SHIRBURN CASTLE - the castle is thought to have been built in 1377 ,although some claim that it dates back to Norman times. It is made of 7 different types of brick, the oldest being local chalk. It still has a working drawbridge and a moat fed by an underground stream from the Chilterns. In the Victorian times Lady Macclesfield used to apprentice all the children in the area and give them a trade either in the onsite laundry, bakery,smithy, carpenter's workshop, stableyard, garden, brewery, dairy or as one of the many servants in the house. The castle has about 47 rooms. It is still lived in by the Macclesfields. There is also a private church and cemetary.
